channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A plane catches fire at a South Korean airport with reports of 28 dead
item.description: South Korea's emergency office said the fire was put out and rescue officials were trying to remove passengers from the Jeju Air passenger plane at the airport in the South Korean city of Muan.
item.content:encoded:
South Korea's emergency office said the fire was put out and rescue officials were trying to remove passengers from the Jeju Air passenger plane at the airport in the South Korean city of Muan.

(Image credit: Maeng Dae-hwan/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: WHO chief recounts narrow escape at Yemen airport hit by Israeli missile
item.description: The World Health Organization Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus says he and colleagues "escaped death narrowly" when an Israeli airstrike targeted Yemen's main airport.
item.content:encoded:
The World Health Organization Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus says he and colleagues "escaped death narrowly" when an Israeli airstrike targeted Yemen's main airport.

(Image credit: FABRICE COFFRINI/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Magnus Carlsen quits chess championship after refusing to change out of jeans
item.description: The Norwegian chess grandmaster was fined $200 and given a warning by the International Chess Federation (FIDE) to change into acceptable attire or be disqualified.
item.content:encoded:
The Norwegian chess grandmaster was fined $200 and given a warning by the International Chess Federation (FIDE) to change into acceptable attire or be disqualified.

(Image credit: Dean Mouhtaropoulos)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Big Lots reaches deal to keep hundreds of U.S. stores open
item.description: Big Lots said Friday it will be sold to Gordon Brothers Retail Partners, a firm that specializes in distressed companies.
item.content:encoded:
Big Lots said Friday it will be sold to Gordon Brothers Retail Partners, a firm that specializes in distressed companies.

(Image credit: Toby Talbot)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Y2K seems like a joke now, but in 1999 people were really freaking out
item.description: People feared the computer glitch would mean "the end of the world as we know it." Thankfully, Y2K didn't live up to the hype after years and billions of dollars were spent on painstaking preparation.
item.content:encoded:
People feared the computer glitch would mean "the end of the world as we know it." Thankfully, Y2K didn't live up to the hype after years and billions of dollars were spent on painstaking preparation.

(Image credit: Mike Derer)
item.dc:creator: Jack Mitchell

item.title: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen says U.S. could hit debt limit in weeks
item.description: Yellen told Congress her agency will need to start taking "extraordinary measures," or special accounting maneuvers intended to prevent the nation from hitting the debt ceiling, as early as Jan. 14.
item.content:encoded:
Yellen told Congress her agency will need to start taking "extraordinary measures," or special accounting maneuvers intended to prevent the nation from hitting the debt ceiling, as early as Jan. 14.

(Image credit: Susan Walsh)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Olivia Hussey, star of the 1968 film 'Romeo and Juliet,' dies at 73
item.description: Hussey was 15 when director Franco Zeffirelli cast her in his adaptation of the Shakespeare tragedy. The film won two Oscars and Hussey won a Golden Globe for best new actress for her part as Juliet.
item.content:encoded:
Hussey was 15 when director Franco Zeffirelli cast her in his adaptation of the Shakespeare tragedy. The film won two Oscars and Hussey won a Golden Globe for best new actress for her part as Juliet.

(Image credit: Eustache Cardenas)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Israel detains a Gaza hospital director, Palestinian medical officials say
item.description: Gaza's Health Ministry said the head of Kamal Adwan Hospital was arrested along with dozens of other staff. Israel's military alleged Hamas militants were using the facility.
item.content:encoded:
Gaza's Health Ministry said the head of Kamal Adwan Hospital was arrested along with dozens of other staff. Israel's military alleged Hamas militants were using the facility.

(Image credit: Abdel Kareem Hana)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: How to fight ageism in the world around you â€” and in yourself
item.description: Discrimination based on someone's age is so ingrained in society that most of us don't notice it. Yet it affects us all and fighting it not only helps make a better society, it also helps us live longer, healthier lives.
item.content:encoded: Discrimination based on someone's age is so ingrained in society that most of us don't notice it. Yet it affects us all and fighting it not only helps make a better society, it also helps us live longer, healthier lives.
item.dc:creator: Ashley Milne-Tyte

item.title: Severe weather takes a deadly turn in the U.S. South as tornadoes touch down
item.description: The National Weather Service said it confirmed several tornadoes had touched down outside of Houston on Saturday.
item.content:encoded:
The National Weather Service said it confirmed several tornadoes had touched down outside of Houston on Saturday.

(Image credit: LM Otero)
item.dc:creator: Kristin Wright
